definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: Idioms are some unique long-term use of phrases and sentences fixed.
sentences.chinese: 習語是人們長期使用的一些獨特的固定短語和短句。

sentences.english: Now 38 years later, I can still utter some short sentences and vocabulary at ease.
sentences.chinese: 38年後的今天，我仍然能隨囗說出一些短句和詞彙。

sentences.english: This is a list of phrases we are all familiar with and most likely use from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 以下列出的是一些我們熟悉的並且經常使用的短句。

sentences.english: Use bullets with short sentences to structure the body of your resume.
sentences.chinese: 在簡歷的正文部分，使用短句比使用長句好。

sentences.english: He used short sentences and rough words.
Influenced by ancient chinese expressions and folk colloquialism, he is capable of writing short sentences in soft and lively language.
sentences.chinese: 句式以短句爲主，深受古漢語和民間口語影響。

sentences.english: Laoshan would be the ideal place for you, then.
sentences.chinese: 短句那嶗山將是你理想的地方。

sentences.english: We can express this statement as an epigram .
sentences.chinese: 我們可把這一命題表達爲一個短句。

sentences.english: Bulleting information will help the reader view your accomplishments at a glance.
sentences.chinese: 短句構成的信息可以使閱讀者迅速瞭解你的情況。

sentences.english: This book has a mix of shorter and longer sentences.
This book consists of three volumes, each including 150 short expressions.
sentences.chinese: 本書由三冊組成，每冊包括一百五十個短句。

sentences.english: Poems and essays alike abound in neat turns of phrase, and epigrams that are immediately pleasing.
sentences.chinese: 詩文中充滿了簡潔的短語和讀來清晰可喜的短句。

sentences.english: This phrase is often used as a parenthesis, which appears at the beginning or in the middle of a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 這個短句一般用做插入語，位於句首或句中。

sentences.english: Start the article with a short sentence, not more than 8 words.
sentences.chinese: 文章開首用短句，不要跨越8個字。

discourse/group of sentences with clear meaning/narrative
